|Title=Know the definition of acute pericarditis
|Description=None
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Jennifer Cautela
|Order=1}}


* Acute inflammation of the leaflets of the pericardium
* Accompanied by pericardial effusion or not ("dry pericarditis")
* If associated with elevated troponin = myopericarditis

question.title: What is a characteristic of acute pericarditis?
question.description: Choose the correct definition of acute pericarditis.

option_a.title: Accompanied by pericardial effusion or not (dry pericarditis)
option_a.description: This is a characteristic of acute pericarditis.

option_b.title: Always accompanied by elevated troponin levels
option_b.description: This is a characteristic of acute pericarditis.

option_c.title: Always accompanied by inflammation of the leaflets of the pericardium
option_c.description: This is a characteristic of acute pericarditis.

option_d.title: Never accompanied by pericardial effusion
option_d.description: This is a characteristic of acute pericarditis.
